dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circa 1900.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white man in a top hat introduces the final act of a bl face performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the spirit of true minstrelsy, you have again shown that laughter is the wine of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some 50 performers stand and break out into song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll credits to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An average American teenage boy begins to speak. His name JOLIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life, my parents have told me I'm smart and talented. That I can be anything I wanna be when I grow up. Getting into the West Branch Magnet Program was supposed to be some kinda honor. They probly thought I'd grow up to be a doctor, or a lawyer, or scientist that cures cancer and junk. I mean for me school has always been a breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in the mid-90s, for our story present day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when I look around, I just feel surrounded by dorks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on an old school hoop on the horizon. A kid silouet against the sky lays the ball in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) All I want, is to be like the kids on varisty, who live in the Maple Ave towers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A part of a suburban neighborhood lines with huge apartme buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) The maple ave kids are coming up from nothing. I mean, their only shot at college is balling. And they've got girls blowing up their pagers twenty-four seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black kids play ball apartment buildings towering over th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young naive face of Jolie in the midst of tryout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) I pray to God I make varsity. I'd do anything to be like the Maple Ave. kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage of tryout - Jolie the olny white kid among them. Suicide drills. Push ups. Machine gun defensive stand exercises. Scrimmaging. Jolie is just a breath behind everyone at pretty much all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Jolie is at the line. A classic american basketba tryout drill. Miss and you run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the players but Jolie watch from the baseline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie lines up his shot carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glaces at the coach who holds a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie fires. For a split second it's dead on but then it bricks wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids take off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of a high pace video game begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOLIE, in his tighty-whities, plays Sonic on a Sega Genes Also on the bed, black girl HENRIETTA AARONSON tries to d her homework.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you're gonna make varsity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie drops his controller and tears up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School is so wack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I support you no matter what. But I can't be changin' no diapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta looks defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie pauses Sonic. Curls up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whisper) I've been fucking Henrietta for a while. She's the best. She's pregnant with someone else's baby but I'm cool with that. In fact, I think that's why I like her so much. She's kinda thugged out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie rubs her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stomach's smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now Jolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you look more beautiful like this than anything. I wish you could be this way forever. We'd be so happy like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drop of sweat runs down Henrietta's face and lands on a sheet of paper full of algebra equations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie, now clothed, bounds down the stairs with bookbag a basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Aaronson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emerging from kitchen) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got my check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit man, those hours really add up, hun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Aaronson grabs his checkbook off the top of the TV an heads to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie flips on the TV and catchs a little of the OJ Simps trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O) Henrietta's adopted. She lives in a big house like me. Her parents pay me to tutor her in geometry. She's kind of an outcast. I think that's why we click. Plus, our moms both work for the same law firm. They fly all over the country doing somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Aaronson flips off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a mess... So, how do you think she's doing? Is she gonna pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I don't know. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Aaronson tenses up, then relaxes again and hands over check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. She was always a great student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching for word) ...you know... Geometry's a hard thing. Algebra leads to it and if you dont get that then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah I guess so. Well, you do what you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bells RINGS. Ethnic murals line some of the walls, ot are just the old school red brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) My great great grandfather was a famous black face performer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changing classes. Kids of all shapes, sizes and colors. J emerges among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used to call him the greatest performer of all time. But now. Kids at school have never even heard of him. I mean not even magnet kids in AP history have heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie and his best friend HAROON are in the back. Haroon' scrawny Afghan boy with glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon glances at his bulky calculator watch and raises h hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I be excused for the Million Man March?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I use the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher MR. MCCARTY already has the passes raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty except Jolie and Haroon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, don't they post who made the team today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, not till Monday they said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright man, have a good day at school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smack a secret handshake and Haroon exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Jolie looks longingly out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon waves good-bye to Jolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minority kids are hopping into cars with their march sign psyched to be getting out of school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whisper) This sucks. All the minorities get an excused absence for the Million Man March.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An almost white looking kid enters the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) But me, I'm stuck in school like a bama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon waves a last goodbye from his Nissan Saturn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie - still looking enviously out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) I wish I was one of them. I wish I was one of them. I wish I was one of them. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta rocks out to her walk-man while jamming on some homework.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie's in his underwear again playing Sonic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) I'm supposed to tutor Henrietta every Sunday. She's getting an F in math. She knows how to do it though. She's flunking on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks back at Henrietta and smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) She's so gangster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie, clothed, bounds down the steps again, this time tw a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suburban homes with large apartments towers in the background. The school is in the more urban part of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors spray-painted "thug life."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie and Haroon sit on the hill doing homework.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you heard Fransisco got arrested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANCISCO, bare chested, struggles against a security gua He looks directly into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm innocent, this is bull shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over some pictures on the Internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you mean like netscape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo dont forget I need my computer homework back by Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you. Dont forget to get me my bio homework back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walk into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whisper) My great great grandfather had a song, Hallelujah I'm a Bum. Tupac had a song, I'd Rather Be an N.I.G.G.A., so we can get drunk and smoke weed all day. I always thought they were really similar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon and Jolie in identical poses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. I gotta take a massive dump, will you guard the door while I'm in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise their hands - again in identical positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon in the stall taking a dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie at the urinal - simultaneously pounding a Sunkist a taking a whiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking the most epic shit. Oh! Dude! Don't they post who made the team today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks suddenly worried. It dawns on him. He rushes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget I need my computer homework back? Jolie!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie rushes toward the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) As a white boy at West Branch I'm just not cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's zeroing in on a wall full of sports posters - at it' center a golden piece of paper labled "THE TEAM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But making the team would change my life forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks down the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) It's my one shot to fit in with the Maple Ave kids. To actually be somebody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie's face brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie walks past it and does a double take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JOLIE'S EYES: pure intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands motionless, holding his breath, reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then leans back, covering his dropped jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whisper) Making the team, felt like the most important thing in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie takes off running down the hall past a mop leaning against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whisper) As a white boy I just didn't fit in, not in Takoma Park. But now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie becomes a black silhouette against a row of windows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whisper) I was practically black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie, in his gold Webber jersey, hops in the woods. He w large purple ankle weights, and "Jump Soles" (clunky and clumsy looking work out shoes).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whisper) I even ditched class to work on my hops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Jolie gathers his basketball and backpack and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A metro train roars past in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie is bench pressing and Haroon is spotting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single florescent fixture hangs overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I can't believe you made the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie finishes his set. Pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the last bama on the list! If Francisco hadn't been arrested I'd still be a loser! I'd be just another Joe Shmoe Lame-oh geek in the Blair High School Magnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HAROON: his face slowly falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey, can your mom give you a ride home later. There's something I gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Yeah. Yeah. That's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rotate positions - we see that Jolie has only been lifting 5 lb. weights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2.5's right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie leans down on the bar and grins to himself - still cloud nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shiny cherry-red '93 Nissan Quest approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over, whispering) Tupac. Biggie. Snoop Dog. Easy-E. Dr. Dre. Suge Knight. Mr. T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Quest pulls to the curb - Jolie and his Dad inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright bye. No injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie hops out in black and red basketball gear - black headband, black Jordans, even black socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, bye Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clunker 90s cell phone rings. Jolie's Dad answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you back from the hill? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta sits alone on a stump listening to her Walkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie bounds down a path startling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smells like dog shit in these woods, Jolie. Why'd you want to meet out here anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie chokes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That is pretty bad. It smells like a dead mouse or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dont want to be seen with me do you? Cus I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna make out with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea but, I can't. Not no more. We can't be hanging out any more. You understand though right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta, I told you. I made the basketball team. I'm a Blazer now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta looks crest fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie hacks up some spit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. If I make the NBA I'm gonna take care of you and your baby. We're gonna live in a big house in Potomac. Be rich, have maids. That's the reason I'm doing this. Can't you see that? Can't you be happy for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta shakes her head in utter disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops Jolie's basketball and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pregnant, her ass might be a little bigger than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie spins his basketball on one finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need a token for the bus or some junk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crushed, Henrietta leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie watches her descend through a romantic archway of b - a blacktop and basketball hoop in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt bad but,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie darts up the hill - basketball in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta had rich white parents. And after I made the team

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: his black shoes and socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized, compared to me she wasn't thugged out at all. She was just bad at Algebra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie disappears into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a while I was worried her Dad, Mr. Aaronson, would be mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie runs past a jungle gym with a little boy hanging fr the monkey bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was cool. He even offered me 20 bucks to mow the lawn. So, everything worked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie jogs past a pregnant woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blazers dress after practice, everyone chatting among many aisles. But Jolie is all alone in an aisle by himsel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie slams the locker door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie is deep on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The acoustics are bad. The semi full bleachers fill the s with echoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is various shades of black. A lot of them have their feet kicked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classic red versus blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The action on the court is fast paced. The players are disciplined, setting screens and running concrete plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDEL, a guard, pulls up for a shot - swish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheerleaders get excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The home score flashes red and reappears as 86 to 52. A b out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team of Blair Blazers sit together, their heads movin unison, following the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the bench are ARIUS and Jolie. ARIUS, cover in sweat, is a tall thin, care-free, light-skinned black He has a huge scar on his head, a thick red headband and aids over his earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie is bone dry and still in his warm up suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it comes with two free controllers and the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not paying attention) Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We were playing that joint at my place and one of the cheerleaders was all confessing how cute she thinks you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to the cheerleader

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine Ortanyez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie focuses in on a particularly cute Panamanian cheerleader - CHRISTINE ORTANYEZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOLIE POV: slow motion of Christine - taps her palms and a leg kick then looks directly at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Dale - in afine suit and gold rimmed glasses - glar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie rips off his warm-ups in a panic. The shirt gets st over his head, then he trips over his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His teammates look on with various expressions of concern laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheerleader from the opposing team points and giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S.) Unsnap it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling, Jolie frees himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Dale shakes his head and so does the fat black man directly behind him. Their expressions match exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old white referee blows his whistle hard - game over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Blazers start high-fiving each other but Jolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A six foot long poster of a '91 Lamborghini Countach cove the wall. A Nerf basketball hoop hangs on the closed door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon is dressed up as a woman, using a wig, socks as breasts, and a sheet as a skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on man, we've gotta nail the Marion Barry skit tomorrow or I'm gonna get a B in English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like it. I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie throws an African hat and tap shoes off his bed and they smash against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it's was just a preseason game, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, if I can't get in when we're up thirty in the preseason then I'm never gonna play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie pulls off his jersey and throws it down. He picks u switch blade and looks at his warped reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to put you in the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, for thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie wipes a teary eye and straights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIOTT, Jolie's oddly old dad - enters with a bright ora Nerf ball off the bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott dunks and freezes in mid air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes the sounds of a sold out crowd, animatedly, in a comforting way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Haroon. Let's get you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon follows him down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott, will you go over this skit with me. I think you'll really like it and I need to practice or I'm gonna get a B in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There voices fade into silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie stands alone, grabs a dumb bell and does a few curl He pushes it up his bicpt with his hand so that it looks bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie climbs in through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only light in the room comes from the Sega on pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you know I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie kissed her with lots of tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best. I love you forever Henrietta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna help take care of my baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd do anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie turns off the TV, and in the near darkness of just night light quietnly mounts her.

dialogues.text: Henrietta. Come on? We're not together anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Spud Web only gets a roster spot because he's a circus freak. He shouldn't be there, and that's why he sells tickets. Don't you get it. He's not good, he's just a draw. Is that what you want to be, a circus freak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won the dunk contest. The guy's a beast. You're way out of your league.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The league is about making money. Jolie, the only reason you even got on varsity is because your Dad paid for the new uniforms. You never would have made it even with Francisco getting arrested. Don't you realize that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he did. They cost over two thousand dollars. How could you not know that? I mean you made Varsity at Blair after being cut from JV last year. When have you ever seen that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news hits Jolie hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. Where did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad talking to your dad on the phone in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks at his bandaged hand - lost in deep depressin thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta leans into Jolie. Strokes his leg. Jolie, defea leans into her comforting arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still love you, though. None of that matters to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta's father knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, we're studying here! Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I just wanted to see if you guys needed anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for a moment as the kids are frozen, then we hear head down stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie lies down and Henrietta spoons him. They cuddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon illuminates: Jolie leaves with his Dad and a fat rice crispy treat in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a Black Volvo and an old Red Volkswagen Bug and Golden Retriever sleeping in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hop into the Minivan. Jolie takes a big bite of the crispy treat as they drive past a "speed hump" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have been good for Henrietta too, because afterwords, she didn't mention joining the team to the Bowe fight, she didn't mention Christine, she didnt mention nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive off Jolie looks back at Henrietta's home getting smaller and smaller. A speed hump sign in the foreground, and a basketball hoop set up on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still though, I was worried she'd show anyway. If she did, I didn't know what I was gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide, dark, empty streets, lit up by pools of light from street lamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon and Jolie cross to: Muhammad Ali's Chicken, a restaurant with TV's in the windows, and a color scheme o red, black, and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she was just pissed because you didn't invite her to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it sounds like she was really freaking out. I mean you said she smashed their PC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, when I first got there she didn't even have any clothes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She threw her pajamas into the fireplace. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I mean maybe something more is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a BLIND BLACK MAN in a black suit poking around seeing-eye stick, trying to orient himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, she's pregnant and it sounds like she's keeping the baby. Like she's fulfilling some need or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - the need for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cackle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wear a condom right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to. She's pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah man. Ah man. That is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter and their demeanors shift - they both affect bravado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon and Jolie walk threw looking for their friends; we take in the setting as they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old dude finishes a coke through a straw; we hear the bubbling noise. The giant plastic cup has a picture of Muhammad Ali in his prime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B & W Muhammad Ali posters fill the walls. Ali stands glory over his unconscious opponents, or lays blows to th faces, sweat frozen in the air as it flies from their bod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food is laid out cafeteria style. The tables and boot are a step above any fast food joint. Televisions hang fr every angle, some even face the streets to attract pedestrians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On every television, without exception: a boxing match. B versus a large white guy, Golota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching are about a hundred and fifty black people of al ages, mostly male, packing the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd subdued by the early rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie finds his friends from the team and their girlfrien lining the shinny metal railing that guides people along buffet style assortment of chicken and biscuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie is the only white person in the whole spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see those guys who killed Jordan's Dad got life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said, if only they had seen the license plate, Airness. They --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never would have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, my dad just 911-ed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you get a pager?! That is tight, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week. You just haven't been around that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon peels off as the crowd ad-libs excitement. Jolie l to the match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the fight itself, close up on the television:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowe has Golota cornered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of blows are deflected and Golota, the lug, clin Bowe in a bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointment from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sucker move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd roars again, but this time they rush to the win - jostle for a view of the street where:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two black kids wrestle on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Haroon behind them on the pay-phone, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids fighting have jeans that are falling off and one them has lost a gym shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the windows everyone cheers them on, pounding the Plexiglas. Including Jolie and Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above them in the windows are two televisions of the figh that face the street. In the TV, the boxers and the refer shuffle aimlessly around the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids on the sidewalk are scrappy; they grab and stret at shirts; neither can escape the others' grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a stalemate, knotted awkwardly and exhausted; replaced by heavy breathing; one has a bloody nose and a scratch on the cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ripped my Polo shit, motherfucker! You ripped my Polo shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scratched my face, nigger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd watches the stalemate and the cheering and poun mellows, slowly they bore, returning to their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly on the television there is a whirlwind of action punches are chaotically thrown by both fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts at the televisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids on the sidewalk remain tangled, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On television Golota throws a combo of blows below the be and Bowe tumbles to the mat. The referee jumps and waves furiously at the penalty which he reports to the judges i series of arm waves and animated hand signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the people in the front rows at the boxing match, almost all white, and wearing glamorous suits and dresses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrons go berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extreme close-up on the replay: Golota pounding Bowe in t nuts; Bowe's face distorted in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ad-lib excitement from everyone but Jolie who is looking at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangely Henrietta never showed. I should have been relieved, but instead I felt awful. It was like yesterday we were in love and today she didn't even care I was with Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at the TV - Golota has won - his arm is rai he's the new champion of the boxing world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little gravel parking lot is filled to the brim. Kids all shapes and sizes are gathering. Some carry signs. Mos are wearing red and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opposing school kids wear blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S.) This is what it all comes down to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets lined with cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids and parents walk in droves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S.) This is where we find out what we're made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line spirals around the corner and down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S.) What we have trained for, not just this season, but for you seniors, the last four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A ticket torn at the door. One in a long line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Dale is directly in front of a stand alone chalk bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S.) Is it unfair that we drew Springbrook in the first round? Yes. Random seeding is only because the sorry white schools complained to the school board about always losing in the first round. When I was younger the regular season meant something around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Dale begins diagraming the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that means nothing now. We gotta go out and play no matter what. We're gonna open in a one- twenty-two. Wendel on the ball, Pistol on the two. Falling back into the half court, we go one- twenty FIVE. Forcing left. Trap and take the throwback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jolie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's such a goof ball, man. This is the playoffs. Where is he at?! Who's seen Jolie?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Cheerleaders drag Jolie, with his bandaged thumb, t the showers. Jolie looks genuinely scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Bart. I know you're the cheerleading coach and all, but this really better be important. I'm supposed to be in the weight- room by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're injured. And like I said, this is more important than any basketball game. This is life or death Jolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the last shower stall - Christine on her k in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie steps into the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coach leaves them alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie. I haven't had my period in three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie gets on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you should get one of those things and check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pregnancy test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant with your baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cries and shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worries. My Dad will let me put it on his credit card. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Jolie has a face of determination. He unwraps hi bandaged thumb and throws it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not your fault. I gotta run though. Let's talk about this after the game, OK? The team needs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine nods but clearly wants to refuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? You're injured anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ok though. I can play through it. do you understand. I just gotta do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I just told you I'm pregnant with your baby. Doesn't that mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight I'm gonna play for you and our baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie kisses her and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie sneaks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Dale notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie! Where the hell have you been!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got stuck with no toilet paper, coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn man. This is the biggest game of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It wasn't my fault. I gotta be light on my feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hand is all better. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie takes a ball from an assistant coach and pounds it showing no sign of pain. Then palms it in his bad hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale stares at him like he's a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go baby! Bring it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coaches exit, and the players quiet down for a quick prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail Mary Full of Grace, the lord is with you, blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb, Jesus. Holy Mary Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domination baby! Domination!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team snaps into game mode forming a single file line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two assistant coaches scramble in with game balls and hand them off to the first and second players in line. Jo ditches his practice ball and files in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players start clapping in rhythm. One. One, two. One. One, two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night. I never played. None of us did. Because there never was a game. Before the opening tip even kicked it off a fight between schools broke out in the crowd. Some fired a gun twice, and all hell broke loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of Wayne Avenue fills with police cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mobs of kids and parents and players flee the scene. Amon them are all the characters we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDEL and WENDELS MOM duck into their old Buick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine's and CHRISTINE'S MOM run for their Lexus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Aaronson and Henrietta run for their VW van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROON'S DAD and ZEKE and Haroon sneaks him off to the go 80's Nissan hatchback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie and Elliott run and duck behind the red Nissan Ques mini van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie, are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Was that gun shots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Stay down just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the van, Jolie and Elliott see Francisco, Arius and Hunio all running into the woods among the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lined with windows, yields a view to an empty hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie sits, waiting...sees Christine and a couple other cheerleaders, no longer in uniform, pass by. Jolie waves Christine holds up both hands as if to say "come on" and continues walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a group of black girls come barreling down the hallway like they are possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are followed in droves by other minorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black girls bounce up and down and cry and paw at each ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black boys and kids of other races, not quite as ecstatic still amazed join the celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of kids are slammed loudly against the window in excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the glass Jolie can hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won! We won! We won!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE in the top left corner in white letters: OJ Simpson was just found not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is growing into total commotion and chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie walks through the doorway into the hall and the cam follows without a cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks out of place as he takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wild scene rages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks back into the main office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray comes out of Principal Ganus's door. His eyes red fro tears, he curses to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Ganus emerges, acknowledges the commotion in th hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OJ Simpson....not guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Ganus is stone faced. He gestures Jolie into hi office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray brushes shoulders with Jolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who you're stepping to, Ray. A little white boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray blows it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie. Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I'm not proud of what happened in that gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by proud school ornaments and paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie sits alone in a chair, an empty chair adjacent him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone who was caught fighting is being suspended for a minimum of three days. And that includes most of the team. But a suspension for you would only tarnish the reputation of the Magnet program. So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Ganus thumbs through a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to do this school a favor,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the international math meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Jolie a form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great your freshman year. Your calculus teacher tells me your still great, but for some reason you quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made JV that year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's going to be no rematch of the Springbrook playoff game. Both teams are forfeiting. So now you've got plenty of time, that's for damn sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not rescheduling our game? That's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The math team needs you Jolie. We're on the verge of nationals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL GANUS (cont'd) This year we settles for nothing less than number one, second to none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In whole numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The principal laughs at his own joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, Jolie grabs his bag and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, one more thing. You will also join the team for an additional 40 hours of community service, as part of the new "Adopt a Highway" Program. It's part of the team punishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not fair man. I mean everyone got suspended on the team but me. Just because I'm in the Magnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up dude. Life's not fair. Who ever said it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you wanna do that? We're in the middle of C hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. I don't give a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? On Mr. Applebaum's door? Yall have been warring. He's gonna know it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon pulls out a spray-paint can and writes the words 'Thugg Life' over Mr. Applebaum's classroom door and wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just sprayed painted `thugg life' on Mr. Applebaum's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They admire the work for a moment. Then run for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst through an exit and out into the blinding ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon and Jolie run into the teachers' parking lot ducki between cars as they catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could get suspended for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? What does school even matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gotten into you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe my parents are getting divorced and you don't even know about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon draws the spray can like he's about to go to work the cars, but Jolie fights him for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimmie my spray-paint! Owww. Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for your own good. This car belongs to Principal Ganus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stair each other down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, of all the things you have to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you numb? The whole school knows Christine is pregnant with your baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. It's not like that. She's gonna get an abortion. She comes from a wealthy family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what if she does. Doesn't it mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know what it means. It just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie ponders the situation. Haroon shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie pulls out a magic marker and begins to write on the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic marker? That is so lame. Don't get me started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon pops the top of his spray can and begins to shake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit by a TV, the room could be it's own apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendel sleeps with a Super Nintendo controllers in his la on a futon. Arius, Codroy and a few kids from the team ar asleep all around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) Once everyone heard that I got Christine pregnant, it was like I was the coolest kid in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids from the team wanted to hang at my place while my parents were gone. And even some cheerleaders came too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine and Jolie make-out, lying on the floor/power pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O., cont.) I told them all it was Haroon who spray-painted `Free Mike Tyson,' and even he was cool too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon, half asleep, sparking the tail end of a blunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O., cont.) We even smoked a blunt. It was our first time gettng blazed and drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soda cans, crumbs, bags of chips, and other treats and wrappers are scattered around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the television: the audience laughs wildly at a Monkey doing sign language on the Carson show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he saying now? What's he signing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guest interprets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to say he loves you all, and he wishes he could hang onto these people a little longer, connect with them a little deeper, before it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carson crowd laughs wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie's hand slides up Christine's skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie! No way. Not until you know what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? You've been saying you're gonna get your Dad's credit card for like a month. Time is of the essence here, duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I'm on it. First thing when my parents get back. But this is the best time to do it because we dont have to wear a condom. Come on, let's go upstairs. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches back up her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No means no, Jolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon comes out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. I am blazed out of my mind right now, but I think someone's hiding in your shower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forreal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, dude. Check it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie grabs a portable phone, bracing himself for battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn Henrietta. You scared the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you doing in my basement bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm catching you cheating with Christine! You asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. People are sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me. You think I dont know shit. She's pregnant with your baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the Maple Ave. kids don't hear mad junk about the Magnet kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta, relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about all that stuff, how y'all hooked up during floor hockey intramurals under the trampoline. Everything. You think I don't have friends? I have friends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I know you have friends Henrietta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm a fool? I watched you make out with her on the Power-pad two second ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crying, Henrietta exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basketball team and cheerleaders have woken up from t argument, and are now enraptured by the drama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie and Haroon looks like dear in headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this time you've been hooking up with some pregnant girl failing out of school. I am so fucking humiliated right now. Don't you ever, ever, ever so much as speak to me again. Come on girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine and three other cheerleaders leave the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn Jolie, all the girls just bounced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids from the team leave and Jolie and Haroon stand alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn man. I better go too. This shit is too fucked up right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie stands all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street sign reads Maple Ave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is lined with tall apartment buildings. Government housing. Bus stops. And cheap liquor stores and sub shops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie walks down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O.) The next day I found out Christine had the abortion on her own. She said she asked the doctor to see the fetus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie approached one of the apartment buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O., cont.) The doctor said she wasn't supposed to showed it, but did anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie buzzes up to an apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O., cont.) Christine said the dead fetus looked like a baby squirrel. Like the ones that fall out of the nest and are on the sidewalk dead with no fur yet. I guess it went well though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room of a small dim one bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensual R&B tunes play softly from a small radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O., cont.) After that Arius said not to worry about anything. That Christine would be cool, and Henrietta was just fucked up anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gold cross hangs on the fake wood paneling with some fr family photos at a summer bar-b-que, a wedding, and the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O., cont.) He even invited me back to his place. It was the first time I had ever been to Maple ave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four kids from the team are playing cards around a coffee table for one dollar bills siting mostly on a puffy flora patterned couch covered in shinny plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O., cont.) Everybody played this ghetto version of Jin Rummy called `Tunk.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all wear Addidas flip flops with socks and name bran sweatpants (Hillfiger, Nautica, Polo, etc.). Some of the have on athletic shorts on under their sweatpants,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, Jolie has a gray ratty hoody on, and i hunched over and old PC computer with Arius, a beer-belli balding black dude who is smoking a cigarette and has no shirt on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie, you want in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else, other than Jolie, is also shirtless. The k have exquisite ABS, the kind you see on television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. I gotta see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Here it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arrow clicks on the play button, but the image stays frozen: a low res picture of a bare ass black man mounted miliary style on a black girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image moves for a brief moment. We hear a grown with a thrust, and the image freezes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it reverts to the beginning image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is the future right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wont it go play or whatever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandwidth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie tokes a blunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arius takes a last puff and puts it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little cute six year old girl comes out of the bedroom a sheet of paper and pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arius. Who was the first president of the United States?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, George Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs back into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. That's what it's all about. I'm a capital venturist man. Internet porn is the future of sexual healing. Henrietta was just the first of many. It's big business. Dollar bills man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks on, stoned. Not sure what to make of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A six lane highway banks a sharp curve. It's raining ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the shoulder of the highway are kids from the Blair Basketball team picking up trash with pokers. They are sp out - a kid every 25 yards or so - and together they exte clear around the curve and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie pokes a Coke can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie plucks the can off the end metal nail and realizes also stabbed the tape liner notes of MC Hammer's "Please Hammer Don't Hurt'em." There is a picture of Hammer on th cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach sits in a nearby van with its lights on, parked the shoulder. He sips hot coffee, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks closely at the tape insert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a picture of Hammer but someone has scratched out hi eyes with a pen. And the poker has put a hole through his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure what to make of it all. Why Henrietta's parents never know she was pregant until too late? Or why I never said something myself? It was like none of it really mattered, or was even real at all, until it was too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: An old PC monitor. A picture slowly emerging fr blurry pixilated square of colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that I used the internet to find a bunch of places that would take Henrietta's baby up for adoption. It wasn't easy, but I found all the information right from Haroon's basement, using Netscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture of a couple materializes: hopeful parents and their profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This couple looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. They're perfect. All I have to do is convince Henrietta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys still on good terms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Our sessions are in the kitchen now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adreseis enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the trampoline set-up. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make their way to the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon's brothers have set up a trampoline to dunk on an adjustable rim lowered to 8 ft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The younger brothers do an awesome array of dunks. Jolie Haroon sit on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird, I don't really care if I make the NBA anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What do you care about then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon's youngest brother runs, bounces, and does a 360 j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon's Dad emerges from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, Adreseis!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haroon turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made some grill cheeses! Come and get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet! Now that Mom moved out we always eat American. You wanna eat with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do but there's something I gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. That's right.   Well, good luck with it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henrietta lies on the bed studying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Aaronson enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Henrietta. Jolie is here. He brought over a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Let him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What's up? Uh. I brought over my Super Nintendo. I thought the baby might want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Jaguar 64 finally come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Come on. I'm just trying to show you I actually care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Aaronson smiles and leaves, closing the door lightly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie hands over the Nintendo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I brought this too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie pulls a jersey out of a paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your practice Jersey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm not gonna need it anymore so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not playing next year. I want to focus on my studies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smells like you. Someday little Benny will wear it. That's what I've decided to name him, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Wow. Well. Uh, before you name him, I was kinda thinking maybe we could discuss, uh,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, (Jolie sits next to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was also thinking maybe we could talk about the possibility of you giving up your baby for adoption?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie. How could you even say that? I've wanted a family of my own, a real family, since as long as I can remember. There is no way I could ever give little Benny away. Ever. In a million years. Do you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Yeah. I guess so. But at the same time, it just doesn't seem like the smartest thing. I've already found a really wealthy, well educated, good meaning couple who'd like to meet up with you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. No way Jolie. End of discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you even want to think it over for a few days? I mean, look how lucky your parents are to have you. You'd be making some couple just as happy. And your child would have more opportunities. I mean you're still in High School, know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie, I can't even believe you're suggesting that? Dont you see how racist that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now do something to cheer me up. I am totally offended you wanted to give away my baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie sits in silence for a moment, pondering his situati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up and heads to the door, demoralized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he turns and looks at Henrietta on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolie looks at her bulging belly, much of it exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credits roll to Micheal Jackson's Billy Jean.
